Description: Fragment of neck and oval handle, rising to sharp turn, of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Circular stamp with Helios head symbol.
Production date: 124 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Name Teisamenos. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, BIBALEX 0627.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (275)
